p: Wood is an anisotropic material, with respect to its anatomical, physical, and chemical properties, and is made up of different kinds of cells. Wood is degradable by fungi, microorganisms and heating [ 1]. Degradation of wood and its chemical structure are influenced by the temperature, oxygen available to the material, ambient pressure, wood type and shape, moisture content of the wood, and additives, such as inorganic substances, sorbed emissions, etc. [ 2, 3, 4]. Fedyukov et al. [ 5] progressively describe the decreasing of cellulose content of spruce wood with soil condition deterioration.
